name: Food,Weight,andWaterHealthTrackerforFitbit
0:
”Alexa, tell health tracker I ate a bowl of cheerios, two slices of bacon, and a glass of orange juice for breakfast”
”Alexa, tell health tracker I had a chicken salad sandwich, a bag of cheetos, and a glass of water for lunch”
”Alexa, tell health tracker I weigh one hundred and ten pounds”
skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: health tracker
des:
Log food, weight, and water to your Fitbit account using Alexa. No need to type in what you ate, just say it! Saves time and makes food logging more fun and convenient.

The free version of health tracker allows you to log weight and water to Fitbit and will tell you how many calories were in your meal. If you subscribe to health tracker you can also log your meal to Fitbit, along with calories, fat, carbs, and protein.

You don't have to say foods one at a time... say whole sentences like 'tell health tracker I had a cup of rice, 8oz of sausage, and some kale for dinner'.

Here are some phrases you can try...
'Alexa, tell health tracker I had two chocolate chip cookies and a glass of milk for afternoon snack'
'Alexa, tell health tracker I had sixteen ounces of shrimp risotto and some green beans for dinner'
'Alexa, tell health tracker I ate a snickers bar'
'Alexa, tell health tracker I drank a sixteen ounce bottle of water'
'Alexa, tell health tracker I weigh one hundred and five pounds'

You *must* have a Fitbit account for this skill to work. You can create a free account at www.fitbit.com
